storyInfo: Na Saoirsí is caught up in the Samhain celebrations, but Loughshinny senses that something is amiss. A statue, a 'feast', and barely hidden hatred... What she encounters drives her to meet her sister. Both of them look down at the city engulfed in violet flames.

attributes.content: Extra! Extra! Read all about it!
attributes.name: Newsboy's Voice

attributes.content: The Victorians are retreating, not fighting!
attributes.name: Newsboy's Voice

attributes.content: Tara has gotten back all its territory!
attributes.name: Newsboy's Voice

attributes.content: Peace will be restored to all of Tara by Samhain!
attributes.name: Newsboy's Voice

attributes.content: Stop the cart.
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: I've been ordered to escort you directly to meet Her Highness, with no delays.
attributes.name: Soldier's Voice

attributes.content: Before I meet her, I need to see it with my own eyes—my sister's city, post-war Tara, the survivors and civilians—have their new lives finally begun?
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: ...If you insist.
attributes.name: Soldier's Voice

attributes.content: But the people are not yet prepared for two red dragons—
attributes.name: Soldier's Voice

attributes.content: Of course I know that.
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Just—just take these!
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: These knives, axes, and bowls are all made of iron. They'll make for good materials.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: I beg you, Culann, take them... even if you have to melt them down and make some eyes for our statue.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.text: Autumn is almost over, and mornings in Na Saoirsí are cold and damp.
A pair of scarred, weathered hands rub against the cold and dry metal goods—much like a soldier running their fingers over a medal of valor in wartime.
The people yell out his name, hoping the broken tools in their hands will be accepted, smelted, and used by the hero to forge the statue.
The hero... yes, the hero... Every story needs a hero like that.

attributes.content: Theo! Theo! Come help carry this stuff into the workshop.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: I mean now, Theo! I'll help you sharpen your knife tonight.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: What a lazy brat. This is what you get for pampering him too much.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: No, uh, I mean, doesn't matter if that boy's around, just take everything, please!
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: I can't take everything. We all need these tools to get by. And that goes double for your prosthetic leg.
attributes.name: Culann
Anxious Resident
attributes.content: I—

attributes.name: Anxious Resident
attributes.content: I'm standing up fine, aren't I?
That wooden leg Nemos made is only temporary. Once better craftsmen arrive in town, they can repair your iron one.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: But you're making a statue to commemorate our victory in the war—one that'll be displayed in the main square during Samhain!
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Frankly, it'd be an honor for my rusty old leg to be a part of that.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: No means no.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Just take it, already. It's all old stuff we'd have thrown out while cleaning anyway—no one's got any use for them.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: What's wrong with these bowls? They look perfectly fine to me.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: We can use clay ones instead. As for the axes, we'll just share the few we've got left.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: The war just ended, and the city's short on everything. If we don't help you, how will the statue ever be finished?
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Still, I can't accept used prosthetics, no matter what.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: You're a great man, my hero, but you can be so stubborn!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Loughshinny slowly walks into the crowd.
For some reason, she feels as though there's something separating her from them. As if she's looking at them from the other side of a bonfire.
Excuse me, what are you all doing?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: A new face in town? Haven't seen many of those lately! Where are you from, Vouivre?
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: I've returned to Tara from a place far, far away.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: See, Culann? If you'd just taken everything without a fuss, you wouldn't have embarrassed yourself in front of our countryman from afar.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: My answer is still no. Not the prosthetic leg. The other stuff... fine.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Why are people donating their pots, pans, and prosthetics?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Because we all want to erect a statue in the square for Samhain, to celebrate Tara's rebirth.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: It's to celebrate Samhain?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I've only ever come across the festival in Taran folklore. It's held after the autumn harvest and before winter, yes? And it's meant to connect this shore to the next.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You know your stuff, Vouivre!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: We used to just celebrate the harvest every year. It was the Dublinners who told us about the festival's historical origins.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: So we sweep our houses, prepare feasts for our guests, and most importantly, light bonfires! On the day when life and death intertwine, we welcome all visitors to the banquet... There's so much to do!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: And since this is the first Samhain since Tara's rebirth, it should be even more grand.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Good thing, too. Otherwise, Culann would never accept our old pots even if he had to tear down his own house instead.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Speaking of, do you have any iron of your own you'd like to donate, so the hero can add it to the statue?
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: All I have on me is a bookmark. I think it's made of iron. Will that do?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You don't need to listen to her, Taran from afar.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Haha...
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: So what sort of statue are you making?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: A red dragon, to celebrate Tara's rebirth.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: A red dragon...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I'm telling you, Culann, if you don't take my prosthetic leg, I—I won't leave until you do!
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Then I suppose I'll have to pick you up and carry you back myself.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Ugh! You and your gigantic muscles! By the time Samhain is over and the statue has been erected, we'll all be living the good life. We'll be able to make as many prosthetics as we want!
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Just imagine: a massive dragon statue standing tall in the night. Even through winter, its flames will remain lit, just like in the legends. Why it'd be enough to drive off the man-eating mist...
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: And we wouldn't have to obey that blasted curfew anymore—
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: The curfew is an order approved by the Red Dragon, put in place to ensure our safety.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: I know that. Of course I know that!
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: As they speak, more and more people begin to gather around them, until the alley is completely blocked. They each carry all manner of things meant to be melted down for the statue.
Culann patiently receives each new visitor as the objects at his feet begin to pile up. He's quite a large man, but even he can't carry all of them at once.
Allow me to help you, Culann.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Oh, no need for that. My apprentice, Theo—
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Can you really count on Theo, though? We have no idea where that rascal ran off to! He talks a good game, but slacks off when no one's watching—typical Victorian!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: And how old was he when his parents died? Does he even remember Victoria?
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: So what's your name, friend?
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Reed.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Have you found a place to stay yet? You're welcome to stay at my place for the night—you wouldn't want to be wandering the streets during curfew, that's for sure.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: I think I do. But... a curfew? You mean the city has a lights-out bell?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Not quite. Victoria used lights-out bells to suppress the Tarans. Na Saoirsí's curfew is to safeguard us.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: The black mist lingers in the Dark Woods, shielding all of Na Saoirsí from outsiders, but at times, it also drifts into the city streets.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: The curfew is meant to prevent anyone from encountering the mist. It permits no trespass—anyone who enters without permission will never return.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: You mean the mist really eats people?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...Listen to yourself. You come all this way, and this is what you ask about? Look, things will be better soon, just you wait.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Now come with me. I'll show you around Na Saoirsí.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: What about the man building the statue? Culann, was it? What is he going to do? I know a bit of Arts. Perhaps I could help him.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Oh, don't worry about him! He's a genuine hero! He once dispatched an entire Victorian scout team in the Dark Woods. Unfortunately, he was a bit of a softy at the last moment. He's the only one willing to put up with Theo's nonsense.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: All by himself? Really?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Well, in the woods. The forest has always been on the Tarans' side—Ugh! Stop changing the subject, Reed!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Just come with me and have some ale and stewed meat. It'll warm you right up!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: You must know that you've come home at the perfect time.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Phew. Well, at least there are still potatoes in the store...
Damn! Look at the time! I'm late!
Who's the one charging through here like a wrecking ball—?
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Theo?
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Sorry, sorry. I'm just in a hurry to get back. I didn't mean to bump into you, sir. Here. Let me wipe that off for you.
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: ...You dare to disrespect me, too?
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: What? No, no. Maybe I misspoke. I was just wondering if you needed help—
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Stay away from me!
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: The man raises his cane and strikes Theo hard on the chest, knocking him away.
The morning mist has long since gathered in the uneven crevices of the stone pavement, forming murky puddles. Caught off guard, Theo stumbles backward and falls straight into one.
You Victorian scoundrel! Who do you think you are? How dare you offer me charity?!
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Urgh...!
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Put that cane away! What's going on here?
Are you okay, Theo?
I'm fine, Brigid, I'm fine. I crashed into him first.
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: A rootless nomad and a Victorian mongrel—couldn't ask for a more perfect pair of lowlives.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: You're not exactly making your ancestors proud, Brigid.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: What's that supposed to mean?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Hmph. Forget the Victorian mongrel. What about you?
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: You're descended from the Exiled King, from the very clan that's supposed to warn the Tarans of impending Catastrophes—yet here you are, mingling with the likes of him.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Even during the war, you never cared whether your own people won or lost, you'd just coldly toss those battle reports into the citadel, then go door to door delivering those meaningless personal letters...
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Are you lot even fit to call yourselves Tarans?
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: So, this is the only place you have to go? Why not just go back to Culann?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I... I need to wash my clothes first. Should be quick. You don't need to worry about me, Brigid.
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Of course I'm worried. I came here just to see you, after all.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Hmph. How is a place wrecked by war and left to rot any better than Culann's workshop? At least there you'd have the forge keeping you warm, and hot meals.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: No, it's just that... I don't want to cause him any more trouble. Please—don't tell Culann about what happened today. Okay? I'll be on my way as soon as my clothes dry.
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: I'm not here for him, Theo. I'm here for you, to take you away.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Take me way? Did he say something to you?
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Just what sort of relationship do you have with him, anyway?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: If I hadn't shown up today, were you going to take the beating without fighting back? My instincts are never wrong: if you stay in the city, they'll just keep finding new ways to push you around.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Today, they shoved you into a puddle and beat you with a cane. Tomorrow, who knows?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Anyhow, just come with me. I can take you to the plains, or anywhere else you fancy. Up to you.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: You and me, we don't belong here. And if you've got nowhere else to go, you can always head to Nemos's old place and stay with the wakemen for a while.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I do want to see them, after all the stories Nemos has told me...
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: But I can't leave, not unless Culann asks me to.
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Nemos has no time to look after him, and the dragon statue isn't finished yet. What would he do if I just up and left?
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: But still, thanks Brigid.
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: If you say so. Then I'll take you back to the city before I leave.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: No, don't bother. It's cold out, so my clothes won't be dry for a while. I'll go back then.
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: And if all else fails, I can always take shelter in that abandoned home. Someone left a quilt and bedsheets there, and I've stayed there before. It'll be fine.
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: ...If you really don't want to come with, well, I suppose it's safer here than risking a trip to another city.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: So not even Culann looks after you all the time, huh?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: He has more important things to do. I should be making things easier on him, not giving him something else to worry about.
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Well, goodbye then. Take care of yourself, you hear?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: We're here!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Like I said, you've come at the perfect time. Today we have fresh ale, stew, and oatmeal... if only we had a bonfire.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Shouldn't you save that for Samhain?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: According to the old customs, we can actually light it a few days before Samhain.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Then again, the war just ended, so we really don't have much in the way of firewood. We can't just start chopping down trees, either, because of the curfew.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: At any rate, it's still light out. The sun can be our bonfire today!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: But that's enough chit-chat—take a seat. I'll have them make room for you.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Loughshinny steps forward. In the damp, chilly air, each dish in the lavish spread on the table has the same familiar scent.
Warm, rustic, and simple, yet not what it seems.
She looks around, concealing her surprise, only to find that no one else finds any of this unusual.
...Is this stewed meat?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Yeah. This here is the meat, these are grilled fins, and your cup is full of ale. Oh, right, and we also have oatmeal. I'll go grab you a bowl.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: All the dishes appear to be made of the same thing.
They're all made of potatoes, right?
Their statue is bowls. Their bonfire is the sun. Their feast is... potatoes.
As the friendly resident goes to fetch a bowl of 'oatmeal', Loughshinny stands up and walks toward the cart-and-burdenbeast that has been waiting for her the whole time.
Her Highness will return very soon. Please wait here.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: And this place is...?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Na Saoirsí citadel. The highest point in the city is just up the steps beside you. This is also where Her Highness lingers most, when she's in the city.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: I'm glad to see you aren't filling the halls with candlelight, musicians, and lavish feasts.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I've already told you: the primary reason the city is short on supplies is because trade between Victoria and Tara has not yet fully resumed. We're working as hard as we can to resolve the issue.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: The residents are very understanding of the situation. They hold nothing but goodwill and genuine love for Tara.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Your Highness Eblana!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Leave us.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: At once!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Just what is going on in this city, Sister?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Everyone's celebrating Samhain, except there's no harvest, no bonfire, and the feast is nothing but potatoes!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: If you came here to make me repeat what the Brigadier has already told you, well, I suppose I can play along. I wouldn't want to spoil our long overdue reunion.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I'm more worried about your spear. Where is it now?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: My spear?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: If you're talking about the spear you gave me, it's being stored in a warehouse on Rhodes Island. I no longer need it.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: How can someone with no weapon claim any sort of power? Or forget power—even survival would be a struggle.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I said 'the spear you gave me.'
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Also, you won't kill me. At least, not yet.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: As a puppet that has only just regained its soul, you wouldn't want to break me before you've had a chance to play with your new toy.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Your words are... quite hurtful.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Anyone can be made a puppet, Loughshinny, anyone except you. You are my dance partner, yet you'd rather stand in my shadow than join me on the floor.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Until about a year ago. You finally got bored of me, didn't you?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...I don't recall what you're referring to.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: As for power, I'm not here for power. That power rightly belongs to you.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You've been setting fires all across Tara. Those fires have melted the chains that once bound the Tarans. That much is true.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Then why have you returned?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: To bear witness.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: If you're truly willing to use your power to give the Tarans a new beginning, then I will do everything I can to support you.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Say, for example, that you're too busy to deal with the supply shortages in the city right now. If so, I would be willing to help with that.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Whether I step forward as a second red dragon, or hide my identity as before, it makes no difference to me.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: As noble as ever, my dear sister.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But I can't say whether...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...you would truly be satisfied with that.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The sister I knew wasn't someone who sought power simply to live a life of indulgence. She wanted more than that.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: But so far, every step you've taken has been paved with bones and blood.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I can only pray that's because you've had no other choice.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I sincerely hope I will never have reason to collect my spear and come searching for you.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Not bad. Not bad at all.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: It seems your life of wandering has taught you far more than you ever learned while acting as my shadow.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Let's not beat around the bush. I've made my intentions clear, and you've invited me back. So what is it you want from me?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You'll find out, soon enough.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Until you do, though, why not come with me? I'll show you around the Red Dragon's Lair.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Legend has it that the architect deliberately shaped the plate with uneven elevations to mirror the old Taran capital.

Legend has it that Tara's stonemasons showcased their finest craftsmanship in every building they made—save for one. They refused to add even a single ornament to the citadel, knowing it would be inhabited by a puppet king.
Loughshinny has heard many stories like this, but no story can tell you whether it is itself a true flame, or merely its shadow cast on the wall.
And so, she follows her sister up the steps and looks down at the city with her own eyes.
She sees the empty pedestal in the square below. It seems to be waiting for something massive to be placed upon it.
She sees the winding, undulating cobblestone roads stretching from the square, and the humble stone houses, so simple they inspire a sense of affection.
But after she focuses her gaze and takes a harder look, she finally sees the thing she had sensed before, the thing that had separated her from the other residents.
It is something that definitely does not belong in the city.
Flames?!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Flames.
At a closer look, there are tiny sparks of fire scattered across the city—all the residents, whether talking, rushing to and fro, yelling, or resting, are surrounded by flickering flames.
Purple flames.
What did you do to these people? You've made them into walking corpses, haven't you?!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You just got back from town. You met them yourself. You should know better than I do.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The flames will spread.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Your flames of death should not be spread to the living.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: It is an unfortunate reality, but wherever man resides, so too does death. Whether on the battlefield or in a bustling city. The flames merely hasten the inevitable.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But I must admit, it doesn't sit right with me either.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The dead wander the wilderness, driven by the desires they held in life. While those tainted by the flames of death can never truly start anew... Life and death cannot remain entangled like this, each defiling the other.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But... haven't you been their chief defiler?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No. Death should be mine to command. I cannot have it expanding beyond the boundaries I set.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Well then, my dear sister, what would you like Tara to become? I want your opinion.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Should the living endure and the dead rest in peace? Or should all of Tara become a kingdom of death?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Why ask a question you already know the answer to?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Then it is clear what you must do.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Kill me, Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: While you've been trudging through the crowds, I've been busy preparing.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The moment the tip of your spear pierces my heart, heralding death's embrace, everything tainted by my deathly flames shall leave this realm along with me.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Then, you will become the first and only true leader Tara has seen in decades.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...I will not be your shadow anymore, and we red dragons will not be the monsters they claim us to be—slaughtering our own kin in madness.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Sometimes—often, even—kinslaying can be a virtuous act.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: What about those touched by the your fire—can they really start their lives anew, as you promised?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I have promised nothing about life, Loughshinny, not even for those untouched by my flames.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: As for the cityfolk, they have already been entangled by the violet flames. They will gradually become walking corpses, and eventually leave here with me. This much is certain.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: They are living, breathing people! They fought under your command and won your war for you—they have the right to start anew!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: An unfortunate fate, to be sure, but their fate nonetheless.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: No, Eblana. It shall not be their fate.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What will you do, then?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Loughshinny has more to say, but Eblana has already turned around and started walking down the long corridor. Her footsteps are so soft that Loughshinny did not even realize she had left.
After her sister's figure disappears completely into the darkness, Loughshinny turns her gaze back to the city.
How she wishes it were all just one of Eblana's tricks... but the flames are real.
She clenches her fists, pulls up her hood, and turns to descend the steps.
